comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=48771988 is the grave of Colonel Lewis M. Koehler, retired cavalry colonel.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: El Paso herald., April 24, 1915, HOME EDITION, Cable News and Classified Section, Page 3-B, Image 11, top of col 2. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88084272/1915-04-24/ed-... gives him the rank of Lieut.-Col. among those at a dinner at Fort Bliss, in El Paso, Texas. A couple of months earlier he was a major. El Paso herald., February 23, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 5, top of col 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88084272/1915-02-23/ed-... El Paso herald., February 21, 1916, HOME EDITION, Page 14, col 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88084272/1916-02-21/ed-... reports that Lt-Col Koehler was granted a 30-day leave of absence.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: According to the NYT, March 23, 1907 he was court-martialed in 1907. The sun., March 12, 1914, Page 14 col. 6 reported that in 1914 his brother Benjamin M. Koehler was court-martialed as well. The case of Lewis Koehler is also mentioned in that article.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A description of his career (with photo) is in the Fifthy-seventh Annual Report of the Association of Graduates of the United States Military Academy, West Point 1926 (digital-library.usma.edu/libmedia/archives/aogreports/V19...), pages 101f. Because this document is loading very slowly, I have downloaded the the corresponding pages:

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq and B-59:  Thanks for more information about Koehler here. We will include some of it next time we update the description.
